words.definition: To argue is to angrily speak to someone because you do not agree.
words.example: We argued about where to go for dinner.

words.definition: To communicate is to give information by talking, writing, etc.
words.example: I communicated with Paul about his new ideas.

words.definition: A crowd is a large group of people.
words.example: A large crowd had gathered on the street to see the accident.

words.definition: To depend on someone or something is to need them.
words.example: Children depend on their parents for many things.

words.definition: A dish is a plate.
words.example: She put a clean white dish on the table.

words.definition: If something is empty, it does not have anything in it.
words.example: My gas tank was almost empty, so I couldn't drive my car very long.

words.definition: If something is exact, it is just the right amount.
words.example: Please use the exact amount of sugar for the cake.

words.definition: If something is fresh, it is new.
words.example: I just bought these oranges. They are very fresh.

words.definition: To gather is to collect several things usually from different places.
words.example: Sam gathered some flowers for his mother.

words.definition: To indicate means to show, point or make something clear.
words.example: He pointed to his eyes to indicate where he had hurt himself.

words.definition: An item is a thing that you buy or sell.
words.example: I have many items for school in my bag.

words.definition: To offer is to present someone with something.
words.example: He offered me the keys to his car.

words.definition: The price of something is how much it costs.
words.example: What is the price of this item?

words.definition: A product is something that is made.
words.example: My sister has many beauty products in her room.

words.definition: Property is something that someone owns.
words.example: The house is now my property.

words.definition: To purchase something is to buy it.
words.example: I recently purchased a new car.

words.definition: To recommend something is to say that it is good.
words.example: My doctor recommended that I get some exercise.

words.definition: To select something is to choose it.
words.example: I hope that I am selected to play on the team.

words.definition: A tool is something that helps you do a task.
words.example: A hammer is a common tool.

words.definition: To treat is to act in a certain way toward someone.
words.example: The kids treated the new boy very nicely.
